xxl.core.cursors.unions
Class Flatten

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor
      xxl.core.cursors.unions.Flatten
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, Cursor
public class Flatten
extends AbstractCursor

A flatten gets an input iterator which has a certain hirarchical structure and flattens this structure, so that only the interesting objects are returned.

For more details look into the example inside the main method.

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, AbstractCursor

Field Detail

ITERATOR_FLATTEN_FUNCTION

public static final Function ITERATOR_FLATTEN_FUNCTION
Special function which can be used to flatten a cursor that contains objects and iterators.

getCursor

protected Function getCursor
Function which gets the currently processed element and returns an Object. There are three possibilities:
  1. null (which means that the next element is the next element of the cursor)
  2. A cursor which contains elements (and maybe results).
  3. An other object (the next element to be processed). In this case, the function is called again on the object until the function returns null. Then, the last element is returned.

stack

protected Stack stack
Stack which contains the currently processed cursors.

nextObject

protected Object nextObject
The next object which will be returned.

Constructor Detail

Flatten

public Flatten(Iterator iteratorsCursor,
               Function getCursor)
Creates a new sequentializer backed on an iteration of input iterations. Every iterator given to this constructor is wrapped to a cursor.

Parameters:
iteratorsCursor - iteration of input iterations to be sequentialized.
getCursor - Function which gets the currently processed element and returns an Object.
Method Detail

hasNextObject

protected boolean hasNextObject()
Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next or peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)

The attribute cursor is set by this method to the next input iteration as follows: 

     while (!cursor.hasNext()) {
         cursor.close();
         if (iteratorsCursor.hasNext())
             cursor = Cursors.wrap((Iterator)iteratorsCursor.next());
         else
             cursor = EmptyCursor.DEFAULT_INSTANCE;
     }
If the next input iteration is given by an iterator it is wrapped to a cursor. The method returns whether the currently processed input iteration contains further elements, i.e., the result of the hasNext method of cursor.

Specified by:
hasNextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
true if the sequentializer has more elements.

nextObject

protected Object nextObject()
Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will be accessible by some of the sequentializer's methods, e.g., update or remove, until a call to next or peek occurs. This is calling next or peek proceeds the iteration and therefore its previous element will not be accessible any more.

Specified by:
nextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
